en:
Tripod atop Doric colonette; Harmonia (labelled), seated on a rock
      3/4-view to the left, with her head profile to the right, wearing a himation draped around her
      lower body and over her left shoulder, over a medium-sleeved chiton, a high pony tail, and
      disk earrings, rests her left hand on the rock, and raises her right hand behind her head;
      below her a deer, standing profile to the right; bearded Kadmos (labelled), lunging 3/4-view
      to the right, with his advanced left leg bent, wearing a chlamys over his left arm, an exomis
      belted over a wreath, a petasos on the back of his neck, a scabbard strap over his right
      shoulder, and calf-length strap boots, holds a rock (?) in his left hand, covered by the
      chlamys, and a sword in his lowered right hand; above him, Nike (labelled), hovering 3/4-view
      to the right, wearing a himation draped around her lower body and over her left shoulder, over
      a medium-sleeved chiton, and a sakkos, holding a garland in between her lowered hands; Athena
      (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the left, with her weight on her straight right leg, wearing
      an aegis over a belted peplos, a Corinthian helmet, holding a spear in her upraised left hand,
      and a wreath in her lowered right hand; a snake-like dragon; above, Demeter (labelled), seated
      3/4-view to the right, with her head profile to the left, wearing a himation draped around her
      lower body and over her left shoulder, over a medium-sleeved chiton, and a spiked (grain)
      crown, holds a scepter upright in her upraised left hand, and holds her bent right arm in
      front of her body; below, Eros lunging 3/4-view to the right, with weight on his advanced,
      bent, left leg, holding a garland between both lowered hands; Thebe (labelled), seated
      3/4-view to the left, with her legs crossed, wearing a himation draped around her lower body
      and over her left shoulder, veiled over her head, over a medium-sleeved chiton, and a taenia,
      resting on her bent left elbow, her right hand in her lap; emerging from behind her head, a
      ladder (?); a tripod on a Doric colonette.

<bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 7.914 s.v. Thebe no. 3 (C. Vlassopoulou);
      <bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>, 100, 103, 241 no. 49, fig. 56; <bibl>Robertson

      559 (M.A. Tiverios); <bibl>Add2</bibl>, 341; <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.883
      s.v. Demeter no. 46 (Beschi); <bibl>Shapiro 1988</bibl>, 206; <bibl>McPhee

      <bibl>Vian 1963</bibl>, 38 no. 11 pl. 5; Beckel 1961, 75 n. 669; Grossman 212;
      <bibl>Neugebauer 1932</bibl>, 127-28; W. Hahland, Studien zur attischen

      Ashby," BSR 11 (1929) 27; M. Bieber, "Der Chiton der ephesischen Amazonen," <hi
      rend="ital">JdI</hi> 33 (1918) 52, fig. 3; G.E. Rizzo, ""Vasi Greci della Sicilia.
      Parte I. Cratere di Camarina,"" <hi rend="ital">MonAnt</hi> 14 (1904) 15 fig. 2
      pl. 3; <hi rend="ital">CIG</hi> 8426; <bibl>Roscher</bibl>, 2.1
      (1890-1894) 838 s.v. Kadmos (O. Crusius), fig. 2; E. Gerhard, Etruskische und kampanische
      Vasenbilder (Berlin 1843) pl. C.1-5.
Kadmos and Harmonia at the fountain
